entry.title: louisa.gallery
entry.content:
My sister is a fine arts student at Norwich University of the Arts. Instead of handing in physical portfolios to be assessed, she publishes all of her work on her website. This site’s internals are built with Koken, a content management system designer especially for photography/art content.

Visit the site.
entry.summary: My sister is a fine arts student at Norwich University of the Arts. Instead of handing in physical portfolios to be assessed, she publishes all of her work on her website. This site’s internals are built with Koken, a content management system designer especially for photography/art content.

entry.title: Jeff
entry.content:
This is another random website I made about my dog Jeff. Here I experimented with HTML5 animations.

Visit the site.
entry.summary: This is another random website I made about my dog Jeff. Here I experimented with HTML5 animations.

entry.title: jamesinamerica.com
entry.content:
In 2013 my family and I embarked on a road trip across the USA.I created this blog using Anchor, a CMS. This was once a dynamic website, but since the page is no longer being updated, I converted it to a static page using GNU wget from the Free Software Foundation.

Visit the site.
entry.summary: In 2013 my family and I embarked on a road trip across the USA.I created this blog using Anchor, a CMS. This was once a dynamic website, but since the page is no longer being updated, I converted it to a static page using GNU wget from the Free Software Foundation.

entry.title: Cafe Du Gallery / The Gallery Cafe

link.title: Cafe Du Gallery / The Gallery Cafe

entry.content:
This is a website I made for a local cafe. The restaurant has since changed hands so the website no longer exists.I’m now hosting it myself for demonstrational purposes.

Visit the site.
entry.summary: This is a website I made for a local cafe. The restaurant has since changed hands so the website no longer exists.I’m now hosting it myself for demonstrational purposes.

entry.title: Deer Head
entry.content:
One of my A-Level Product Design assignments was to simply make something with a piece of plywood. I can’t remember the dimensions. I decided to laser cut a mounted deer head, as I have always liked how striking real life mounted deer heads look, but obviously disagree with unnecessarily killing an animal for aesthetics.

2d images of parts to come!!

This is the construction of the deer head, using AutoDesk Inventor Professional. I then rendered the deer head without any textures added.

I then added a wood texture and rendered that.

Physical outcome pictures to come!!
entry.summary: One of my A-Level Product Design assignments was to simply make something with a piece of plywood. I can’t remember the dimensions. I decided to laser cut a mounted deer head, as I have always liked how striking real life mounted deer heads look, but obviously disagree with unnecessarily killing an animal for aesthetics.
